title: Birth
shortDescription: Barack Hussein Obama II is born in Honolulu, Hawaii.
longDescription: Barack Hussein Obama II is born in Honolulu, Hawaii to Barack Obama Sr. and Stanley Ann Dunham.

title: College Years
shortDescription: Obama attends Occidental College in Los Angeles, California, and later transfers to Columbia University.
longDescription: Obama attends Occidental College in Los Angeles, California, for two years before transferring to Columbia University in New York City.

title: Community Organizer
shortDescription: Obama becomes a community organizer for the Developing Communities Project in Chicago.
longDescription: Obama moves to Chicago and becomes a community organizer for the Developing Communities Project.

title: Harvard Law School
shortDescription: Obama attends Harvard Law School and becomes the first African-American president of the Harvard Law Review.
longDescription: Obama attends Harvard Law School, where he becomes the first African-American president of the Harvard Law Review.

title: Teaching and State Senate
shortDescription: Obama teaches constitutional law at the University of Chicago Law School and serves in the Illinois State Senate.
longDescription: Obama teaches constitutional law at the University of Chicago Law School. He also gets involved in local politics and serves in the Illinois State Senate from 1997 to 2004.

title: Democratic National Convention
shortDescription: Obama delivers the keynote address at the Democratic National Convention, gaining national attention.
longDescription: Obama delivers the keynote address at the Democratic National Convention, which brings him national attention.

title: U.S. Senator from Illinois
shortDescription: Obama serves as the U.S. Senator from Illinois and gains popularity within the Democratic Party.
longDescription: Obama serves as the U.S. Senator from Illinois after winning the 2004 election. He gains popularity and becomes a prominent figure within the Democratic Party.

title: Presidential Campaign
shortDescription: Obama announces his candidacy for the presidency and secures the Democratic Party's nomination.
longDescription: Obama announces his candidacy for the presidency on February 10, 2007. He competes in the Democratic primaries against Hillary Clinton and eventually secures the party's nomination.

title: Presidential Election
shortDescription: Obama wins the presidential election, becoming the first African-American president-elect of the United States.
longDescription: Obama wins the presidential election, defeating Republican candidate John McCain. He becomes the first African-American president-elect of the United States.

title: First Term as President
shortDescription: Obama faces challenges such as the Great Recession, the passing of the Affordable Care Act, and the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq.
longDescription: During his first term, Obama faces major challenges, including the Great Recession, the passing of the Affordable Care Act (ACA), and the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
shortDescription: Obama receives the Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to strengthen international diplomacy and cooperation.
longDescription: Obama receives the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009 for his efforts to strengthen international diplomacy and cooperation.

title: Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill
shortDescription: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill occurs, prompting Obama's administration to respond to the environmental disaster.
longDescription: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill occurs in 2010, prompting Obama's administration to respond to the environmental disaster.

title: Assassination of Osama bin Laden
shortDescription: The assassination of Osama bin Laden takes place during Obama's presidency.
longDescription: The assassination of Osama bin Laden takes place in 2011, during Obama's presidency.

title: Re-election
shortDescription: Obama is re-elected for a second term, defeating Republican candidate Mitt Romney.
longDescription: Obama is re-elected for a second term in 2012, defeating Republican candidate Mitt Romney.

title: Second Term as President
shortDescription: Obama focuses on issues such as gun control, immigration reform, climate change, and criminal justice reform.
longDescription: During his second term, Obama focuses on issues such as gun control, immigration reform, climate change, and criminal justice reform.

title: Iran Nuclear Deal
shortDescription: The United States, under Obama's leadership, enters into the Iran nuclear deal.
longDescription: The United States, under Obama's leadership, enters into the Iran nuclear deal in 2015, aiming to limit Iran's nuclear program.

title: Paris Agreement
shortDescription: Obama plays a significant role in the negotiations that lead to the Paris Agreement on climate change.
longDescription: Obama plays a significant role in the negotiations that lead to the Paris Agreement on climate change in 2015.

title: Visit to Cuba
shortDescription: Obama visits Cuba, marking a historic shift in U.S.-Cuba relations.
longDescription: Obama visits Cuba in 2016, marking a historic shift in U.S.-Cuba relations.

title: Presidential Election
shortDescription: Obama campaigns for Hillary Clinton, but she loses to Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election.
longDescription: Obama campaigns for Hillary Clinton, the Democratic nominee, but she loses to Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election.

title: Leaving Office
shortDescription: Obama leaves office and hands over the presidency to Donald Trump.
longDescription: Obama leaves office on January 20, 2017, and hands over the presidency to Donald Trump.

title: Memoir and Obama Foundation
shortDescription: Obama writes his memoir, 'A Promised Land,' and forms the Obama Foundation to promote civic engagement and community leadership.
longDescription: Obama writes his memoir, 'A Promised Land,' which is published in 2020 and becomes a bestseller. He also forms the Obama Foundation, which aims to promote civic engagement and community leadership.

title: Supporting Joe Biden
shortDescription: Obama supports Joe Biden's presidential campaign and assists in his transition to the presidency.
longDescription: Obama supports Joe Biden's presidential campaign in 2020 and assists in his transition to the presidency.

title: Continued Advocacy
shortDescription: Obama continues to advocate for various causes, including healthcare, voting rights, and criminal justice reform.
longDescription: Obama continues to advocate for various causes, including healthcare, voting rights, and criminal justice reform.
